snippet: A group of safety advocates sued the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration, saying the agency has been too slow in strengthening training requirements for commercial big-rig operators.
abstract: Group of safety advocates and the Teamsters union sue Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration in federal court, saying agency has dragged its feet on long-overdue training requirements for commercial truck drivers; deaths and injures involving large trucks have been on the rise, even as overall automobile fatalities have fallen.
lead_paragraph: A group of safety advocates sued the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration, saying the agency has been too slow in strengthening training requirements for commercial big-rig operators.

headline.main: Lawsuit Seeks Stricter Rules for Truck Driver Training
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Seeks Stricter Rules for Truck Driver Training
